creator: annie.laforgue@cstb.fr
text:
Some entities characters like ℓ are not translated in PDF document

The following entities:
ℓ maps to the Unicode character U+02113.
― maps to the Unicode character U+02015.
ϱ maps to the Unicode character U+003F1. 
█ maps to the Unicode character U+02588
○ maps to the Unicode character U+025CB.
▪ maps to the Unicode character U+025AA.

Give # in PDF translation. 

Why? Thanks for your help.

Here are le .fo file lines:

<fo:block>ell : <fo:inline font-family="Symbol">ℓ</fo:inline></fo:block>
<fo:block>horbar : <fo:inline font-family="Symbol">―</fo:inline></fo:block>
<fo:block>rhov : <fo:inline font-family="Symbol">ϱ</fo:inline></fo:block>
<fo:block>block : <fo:inline font-family="Symbol">█</fo:inline></fo:block>
<fo:block>cir : <fo:inline font-family="Symbol">○</fo:inline></fo:block>
<fo:block>squf : <fo:inline font-family="Symbol">▪</fo:inline></fo:block>

creator: adelmelle@apache.org
text:
(In reply to comment #0)
> Some entities characters like ℓ are not translated in PDF document
<snip /> 
> Give # in PDF translation. 
> 
> Why? Thanks for your help.

see: http://xmlgraphics.apache.org/fop/faq.html#pdf-characters

(In reply to comment #1)

I read http://xmlgraphics.apache.org/fop/faq.html#pdf-characters and puted <fo:inline font-family="Symbol"> ... in each line as it is explain but it doesn't work.

Is there an other solution?


> (In reply to comment #0)
> > Some entities characters like ℓ are not translated in PDF document
> <snip /> 
> > Give # in PDF translation. 
> > 
> > Why? Thanks for your help.
> see: http://xmlgraphics.apache.org/fop/faq.html#pdf-characters
creator: annie.laforgue@cstb.fr
adelmelle@apache.org
text:
(In reply to comment #2)
> (In reply to comment #1)
> 
> I read http://xmlgraphics.apache.org/fop/faq.html#pdf-characters and puted
> <fo:inline font-family="Symbol"> ... in each line as it is explain but it
> doesn't work.

This is because the Symbol font also does not have glyphs for the requested characters. 
Try a Unicode font, or at least, look for a custom (TrueType or Type-1) font that is guaranteed to to have those glyphs.
